messages.subject: Re: Omoto Clan Research Request
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you Delwayne for your assistance but I still got the same response from Google along with the same links when I looked up Saijin Omoto and *Saijin Omoto*
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Delwayne for your assistance but I still got the same response from Google along with the same links when I looked up Saijin Omoto and *Saijin Omoto* too like I did when I typed in Omoto-no-Saijin and Otomo-no-Saijin as well but I again thank you for your response to my request. If its okay with you can you enlighten me more on Omoto-no-Saijin based on your opinion and if possible could you see if there is anyone in your group that can also help me out as well. I do know so far from the links I found on him that he was a strategist for Prince Shotoku Taishi but when looking for years he was active and further information on him I can't find anything on him. Other than the links I already have looked at in prior searches regarding Saijin Omoto. I can give you these same links that I found they primarily say the same thing about Omoto-no-Saijin but I would like an expert's opinion on the links that I have looked at and if someone from your group with their expertise can help me out as well on this truly rare person in Japanese history. It will be much appreciated because I think there were some samurais that weren't that famous as other ones were and only were local lords in their villages or retainers for their village. The links I found on Omoto-no Saijin are right here for everyone to look at just in case:

http://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=es&u=http://www.igaryu.com.ar/leyendas.html&ei=a3ZXTbeRGcqatwf57NnPDA&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBgQ7gEwADgK&prev=/search%3Fq%3Domoto-no-saijin%26start%3D10%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26sa%3DN%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26prmd%3Divns

http://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=es&u=http://www.kogaryu.com.ar/delegacion.html&ei=OnRXTfKlLIGatge3yOGQDQ&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CFkQ7gEwBw&prev=/search%3Fq%3Domoto-no-saijin%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26prmd%3Divns

(this is the link that I was talking that has his name as Otomo-no-Saijin when other websites have it down as Omoto-no-Saijin but it also brings up that he was a strategist for Prince Shotoku Taishi)

http://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=sv&u=http://paranormal.se/topic/otomo-no-saijin.html&ei=5MgmTak8kc2eB8-M-JcB&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CDwQ7gEwBQ&prev=/search%3Fq%3DOtomo-%2Bno-Saijin%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26hs%3DqQn%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26prmd%3Divns

again I thank you for your response and hope the best to you and Samurai Archives its a great site and it goes into a lot of Japanese history no one really knows about hope to speak to you again.

Johnny Hunter

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Court Protocols
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone know a good source of straight-forward information about protocols and proper behavior in the Heian-era Imperial Court? Thanks-- --Richard ...
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone know a good source of straight-forward information about protocols and proper behavior in the Heian-era Imperial Court?

Thanks--

--Richard






-----Original Message-----
From: Delwayne Arakaki <delwayne@...>
To: samuraihistory <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Cc: JohnnyH <ronin7411@...>
Sent: Thu, Feb 17, 2011 12:26 am
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Omoto Clan Research Request




Try searching under......... *Saijin* *Omoto*
also, I don't think there was an Omoto Clan... but there is a Omoto
Kyo and Omoto Group

On 2/13/2011 5:24 PM, JohnnyH wrote:
>
> Hey guys, I'm studying the Japanese martial arts and when I look up
> information on the Omoto clan from Japan I always find it
> cross-referenced with the Otomo clan. An example to give is when I was
> looking up information on Omoto-no-Saijin and when I found sites that
> have information on him it is under Otomo-no-Saijin while some sites
> have it under Omoto-no-Saijin. I'm looking for help on information
> regarding the Omoto clan in Japan (not the Otomo clan but I like the
> information your site provides on the Otomo clan) and any help would
> be appreciated in doing so and thank you for the time that you took to
> help me with my request.
>
>

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Omoto Clan Research Request
messages.msgSnippet: Hey guys, I m studying the Japanese martial arts and when I look up information on the Omoto clan from Japan I always find it cross-referenced with the Otomo
messages.messageBody: Hey guys, I'm studying the Japanese martial arts and when I look up information on the Omoto clan from Japan I always find it cross-referenced with the Otomo clan. An example to give is when I was looking up information on Omoto-no-Saijin and when I found sites that have information on him it is under Otomo-no-Saijin while some sites have it under Omoto-no-Saijin. I'm looking for help on information regarding the Omoto clan in Japan (not the Otomo clan but I like the information your site provides on the Otomo clan) and any help would be appreciated in doing so and thank you for the time that you took to help me with my request.
